title: [K-12] Context-Based English Writing Education for Pre-Service Science Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational English Grammar and Basic Science Curriculum Concepts
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented program enabling pre-service teachers to cultivate skills in writing English abstracts and reports reflecting real-world scientific contexts

learning_goals: Learners can write a structured 500-word English draft by analyzing real-world cases in four science fields (physics, chemistry, life sciences, earth sciences).
Learners can apply logical flow and critical thinking techniques required for academic writing using the CCBL (Context-Based Case Learning) approach.
Learners can revise and finalize English writing drafts in science fields at least twice based on peer evaluation and instructor feedback.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
